Issue Model\n\n**File:** `/home/hotschmoe/beads_zig/src/models/issue.zig`\n\nCore structure:\n- **Issue struct** contains all issue metadata (id, title, status, priority, assignee, timestamps, etc.)\n- **Rfc3339Timestamp** and **OptionalRfc3339Timestamp** handle JSON serialization of Unix epoch times to RFC3339 strings\n- Issues support embedded relations: `labels: []const []const u8`, `dependencies: []const Dependency`, `comments: []const Comment`\n- Methods: `init()`, `clone()`, `deinit()`, `validate()`, `eql()`, JSON serialization support\n\n**Models:**\n- **Status** (union enum): open, in_progress, blocked, deferred, closed, tombstone, pinned, custom\n- **Priority** (struct with u3 value): CRITICAL(0), HIGH(1), MEDIUM(2), LOW(3), BACKLOG(4)\n- **IssueType** (union enum): task, bug, feature, epic, chore, docs, question, custom\n\nAll models have:\n- `toString()` method\n- `fromString()` method (case-insensitive)\n- JSON serialization via `jsonStringify()` and `jsonParse()`\n\n### 3. Output Formatting\n\n**File:** `/home/hotschmoe/beads_zig/src/output/mod.zig`\n\nUnified output system supporting 4 modes:\n- **json** - Structured output for machines (also supports TOON format for LLM)\n- **quiet** - IDs only (suppresses most messages)\n- **rich** - ANSI colors and formatting for TTY\n- **plain** - No colors, readable text\n\nKey methods:\n- `printIssue(issue)` - Display single issue in appropriate format\n- `printIssueList(issues)` - Display list of issues\n- `print(fmt, args)`, `println(fmt, args)` - Generic messages\n- `err(fmt, args)`, `warn(fmt, args)`, `success(fmt, args)`, `info(fmt, args)` - Colored messages\n- `printJson(value)` - Raw JSON output\n\n**Initialization:**\n```zig\nvar out = output.Output.init(allocator, .{\n    .json = global.json,\n    .toon = global.toon,\n    .quiet = global.quiet,\n    .silent = global.silent,\n    .no_color = global.no_color,\n});\n```\n\n### 4. Storage Layer\n\n**File:** `/home/hotschmoe/beads_zig/src/storage/store.zig`\n\n**IssueStore** provides:\n- `loadFromFile()` - Load JSONL into memory with StringHashMap index\n- `saveToFile()` - Write all issues back to JSONL\n- `insert(issue)` - Add new issue\n- `get(id)` - Return cloned issue\n- `getWithRelations(id)` - Same as get (all data loaded in-memory)\n- `getRef(id)` - Return reference (no clone)\n- `update(id, updates, timestamp)` - Modify issue\n- `list(filters)` - Query with ListFilters (status, priority, type, assignee, label, limit)\n\n**Storage path:** `<data_path>/issues.jsonl` (defaults to `.beads/issues.jsonl`)\n\n### 5. Show Command Pattern\n\n**File:** `/home/hotschmoe/beads_zig/src/cli/show.zig`\n\nTemplate for other commands to follow:\n\n```zig\npub const ShowError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    IssueNotFound,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const ShowResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issue: ?Issue = null,\n    depends_on: ?[]const []const u8 = null,\n    blocks: ?[]const []const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    show_args: args.ShowArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    // 1. Initialize context (loads workspace)\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return ShowError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    // 2. Get issue by ID\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n    var issue = (try ctx.store.getWithRelations(show_args.id)) orelse {\n        try common.outputNotFoundError(ShowResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, show_args.id, allocator);\n        return ShowError.IssueNotFound;\n    };\n    defer issue.deinit(allocator);\n\n    // 3. Query dependencies if needed\n    var graph = ctx.createGraph();\n    const deps = try graph.getDependencies(show_args.id);\n    defer graph.freeDependencies(deps);\n\n    // 4. Output in appropriate format\n    if (structured_output) {\n        // JSON/TOON mode: build result struct\n        try ctx.output.printJson(ShowResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .issue = issue,\n            .depends_on = depends_on_ids,\n            .blocks = blocks_ids,\n        });\n    } else {\n        // Plain/Rich mode: use output helpers\n        try ctx.output.printIssue(issue);\n        // Additional details...\n    }\n}\n```\n\n### 7. Create & Close Command Patterns\n\n**Create Pattern** (`src/cli/create.zig`):\n- Validates input (title length, etc.)\n- Creates workspace access without CommandContext (manual load)\n- Generates unique ID using IdGenerator\n- Creates Issue struct and inserts into store\n- Saves if auto-flush enabled\n- Returns CreateResult struct with ID and title\n\n**Close Pattern** (`src/cli/close.zig`):\n- Uses CommandContext (standard pattern)\n- Gets issue reference with `getRef()` (cheap lookup)\n- Updates issue status with timestamp\n- Saves if auto-flush enabled\n- Outputs success message with action taken\n\n### 8. \"\\x1b[31m\";\n    35→    pub const green = \"\\x1b[32m\";\n    36→    pub const yellow = \"\\x1b[33m\";\n    37→    pub const blue = \"\\x1b[34m\";\n    38→    pub const magenta = \"\\x1b[35m\";\n pub const bright_green = \"\\x1b[92m\";\n    45→    pub const bright_yellow = \"\\x1b[93m\";\n    46→    pub const bright_blue = \"\\x1b[94m\";\n    47→    pub const bright_magenta = \"\\x1b[95m\";\n    48→    pub const bright_cyan = \"\\x1b[96m\";\n    49→\n    50→    pub const bg_red = \"\\x1b[41m\";\n    51→    pub const bg_green = \"\\x1b[42m\";\n    52→    pub const bg_yellow = \"\\x1b[43m\";\n    53→    pub const bg_blue = \"\\x1b[44m\";\n    54→};\n    55→\n    56→/// Global options that affect output formatting.\n    57→/// This mirrors the relevant fields from cli.args.GlobalOptions.\n    58→pub const OutputOptions = struct {\n    59→    json: bool = false,\n    60→    toon: bool = false,\n    61→    quiet: bool = false,\n    62→    silent: bool = false, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    63→    no_color: bool = false,\n    64→};\n    65→\n    66→/// Output formatter for consistent CLI output across all modes.\n    67→pub const Output = struct {\n    68→    mode: OutputMode,\n    69→    toon: bool,\n    70→    silent: bool, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    71→    stdout: std.fs.File,\n    72→    stderr: std.fs.File,\n    73→    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    74→\n    75→    const Self = @This();\n    76→\n    77→    /// Initialize output formatter based on global options and TTY         .allocator = allocator,\n    98→        };\n    99→    }\n   100→\n   101→    /// Initialize with explicit mode (useful for testing).\n   102→    pub fn initWithMode(allocator: 173→    /// Print a formatted message to stdout with newline.\n   174→    pub fn println(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n   175→        if (self.mode == .quiet) 179→    }\n   180→\n   181→    /// Print a success message (green in rich mode).\n   182→    pub fn success(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n   183→        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n   184→        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.green);\n   185→        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n   186→        defer self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n   190→    }\n   191→\n   192→    /// Print an error message to stderr (red in rich mode).\n   193→    pub fn err(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n   200→        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n   201→    }\n   202→\n   203→    /// Print a warning message to stderr (yellow in rich mode).\n   204→    pub fn self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n   210→        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n   211→        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n   212→    }\n   213→\n   214→    /// Print an info message (cyan in rich mode).\n   215→    pub fn info(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n   216→        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n   217→        if  try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n   221→        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n   222→        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n   223→    }\n   224→\n   225→    /// Print raw bytes to stdout (bypasses mode checks).\n   226→    pub fn raw(self: *Self, bytes: []const u8) !void {\n   227→        try self.stdout.writeAll(bytes);\n   228→    }\n   229→\n   230→    /// Print raw JSON value to stdout (for JSON mode).\n   231→    /// If toon mode is enabled, converts JSON to TOON format for reduced token usage.\n   232→    pub fn printJson(self: *Self, value: anytype) Provides a unified interface for displaying output in different modes:\n//! - plain: No colors, basic formatting (default for non-TTY)\n//! - rich: Colors and formatting (default for TTY)\n//! - json: Structured JSON output for machine consumption\n//! - quiet: Minimal output (IDs only)\n//!\n//! Respects NO_COLOR environment variable and --no-color flag.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Status = models.Status;\nconst Priority = models.Priority;\nconst IssueType = models.IssueType;\n\n/// Output mode determines formatting and verbosity.\npub const OutputMode = enum {\n    plain, // No colors, basic formatting\n    rich, // Colors and formatting (TTY)\n    json, // Structured JSON output\n    quiet, // Minimal output (IDs only)\n};\n\n/// ANSI color escape codes.\npub const Color = struct {\n    pub const reset = \"\\x1b[0m\";\n    pub const bold = \"\\x1b[1m\";\n    pub const dim = \"\\x1b[2m\";\n    pub const italic = \"\\x1b[3m\";\n    pub const underline = \"\\x1b[4m\";\n\n    pub const red = \"\\x1b[31m\";\n    pub const green = \"\\x1b[32m\";\n    pub const yellow = \"\\x1b[33m\";\n    pub const blue = \"\\x1b[34m\";\n    pub const magenta = \"\\x1b[35m\";\n    pub const cyan = \"\\x1b[36m\";\n    pub const white = \"\\x1b[37m\";\n    pub const gray = \"\\x1b[90m\";\n\n    pub const bright_red = \"\\x1b[91m\";\n    pub const bright_green = \"\\x1b[92m\";\n    pub const bright_yellow = \"\\x1b[93m\";\n    pub const bright_blue = \"\\x1b[94m\";\n    pub const bright_magenta = \"\\x1b[95m\";\n    pub const bright_cyan = \"\\x1b[96m\";\n\n    pub const bg_red = \"\\x1b[41m\";\n    pub const bg_green = \"\\x1b[42m\";\n    pub const bg_yellow = \"\\x1b[43m\";\n    pub const bg_blue = \"\\x1b[44m\";\n};\n\n/// Global options that affect output formatting.\n/// This mirrors the relevant fields from cli.args.GlobalOptions.\npub const OutputOptions = struct {\n    json: bool = false,\n    toon: bool = false,\n    quiet: bool = false,\n    silent: bool = false, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    no_color: bool = false,\n};\n\n/// Output formatter for consistent CLI output across all modes.\npub const Output = struct {\n    mode: OutputMode,\n    toon: bool,\n    silent: bool, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    stdout: std.fs.File,\n    stderr: std.fs.File,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Initialize output formatter based on global options and TTY detection.\n    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, opts: OutputOptions) Self {\n        const stdout = std.fs.File.stdout();\n        const stderr = std.fs.File.stderr();\n\n        var mode: OutputMode = .plain;\n        if (opts.json or opts.toon) {\n            mode = .json;\n        } else if (opts.quiet or opts.silent) {\n            mode = .quiet;\n        } else if (!opts.no_color and !checkNoColorEnv() and stdout.isTty()) {\n            mode = .rich;\n        }\n\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = opts.toon,\n            .silent = opts.silent,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with explicit mode (useful for testing).\n    pub fn initWithMode(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = false,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize for testing with custom file handles.\n    pub fn initForTesting(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode, stdout: std.fs.File, stderr: std.fs.File) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = false,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with silent mode (suppresses ALL output including errors).\n    pub fn initSilent(allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = .quiet,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = true,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Issue Display\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a single issue in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssue(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueJson(issue),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueQuiet(issue),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueRich(issue),\n            .plain => try self.printIssuePlain(issue),\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Print a list of issues in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssueList(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueListJson(issues),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueListQuiet(issues),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueListRich(issues),\n            .plain => try self.printIssueListPlain(issues),\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Generic Messages\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout.\n    pub fn print(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout with newline.\n    pub fn println(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt ++ \"\\n\", args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a success message (green in rich mode).\n    pub fn success(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.green);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an error message to stderr (red in rich mode).\n    pub fn err(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.silent) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.red);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"error: \" ++ fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print a warning message to stderr (yellow in rich mode).\n    pub fn warn(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.silent or self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.yellow);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"warning: \" ++ fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an info message (cyan in rich mode).\n    pub fn info(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.cyan);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw bytes to stdout (bypasses mode checks).\n    pub fn raw(self: *Self, bytes: []const u8) !void {\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(bytes);\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw JSON value to stdout (for JSON mode).\n    /// If toon mode is enabled, converts JSON to TOON format for reduced token usage.\n    pub fn printJson(self: *Self, value: anytype) !void {\n        const json_bytes = try std.json.Stringify.valueAlloc(self.allocator, value, .{});\n        defer self.allocator.free(json_bytes);\n\n        if (self.toon) {\n            const toon = @import(\"toon_zig\");\n            const toon_bytes = toon.jsonToToon(self.allocator, json_bytes) catch |convert_err| {\n                try self.stderr.writeAll(\"error: failed to convert to TOON format\\n\");\n                return convert_err;\n            };\n            defer self.allocator.free(toon_bytes);\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(toon_bytes);\n        } else {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(json_bytes);\n        }\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // JSON Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssueJson(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        try self.printJson(issue);\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListJson(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        try self.printJson(issues);\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Plain Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssuePlain(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"ID: {s}\\n\", .{issue.id});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Title: {s}\\n\", .{issue.title});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Status: {s}\\n\", .{issue.status.toString()});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Priority: {s}\\n\", .{issue.priority.toString()});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Type: {s}\\n\", .{issue.issue_type.toString()});\n\n        if (issue.description) |desc| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"Description: {s}\\n\", .{desc});\n        }\n        if (issue.assignee) |assignee| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"Assignee: {s}\\n\", .{assignee});\n        }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try {d}\\n\", .{issue.updated_at.value});\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListPlain(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            const status_abbrev = });\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Rich Mode Helpers (ANSI colors)\n    // self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.bold, issue.id, Color.reset });\n\n        // Title\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  {s}\\n\", .{issue.title});\n\n        // Status with color\n        const status_color = getStatusColor(issue.status);\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Status: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ status_color, issue.status.toString(), Color.reset });\n\n        // Priority with color\n        const priority_color = getPriorityColor(issue.priority);\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Priority: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ priority_color, issue.priority.toString(), Color.reset });\n\n        // Type\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Type: {s}\\n\", .{issue.issue_type.toString()});\n\n        // Optional fields\n        if (issue.description) |desc| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"  Description: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.dim, desc, Color.reset });\n        }\n        if (issue.assignee) |assignee| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"  Assignee: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.cyan, assignee, Color.reset });\n        }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"  Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) CommandContext{\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .output = output,\n            .store = store,\n            .issues_path = issues_path,\n            .global = global,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Clean up resources.\n    pub fn deinit(self: *CommandContext) void {\n        self.store.deinit();\n        self.allocator.free(self.issues_path);\n    }\n\n    /// Save the store to file if auto-flush is enabled.\n    pub fn saveIfAutoFlush(self: *CommandContext) CommandError!void {\n        if (!self.global.no_auto_flush) {\n            self.store.saveToFile() catch {\n                outputErrorGeneric(&self.output, self.global.isStructuredOutput(), \"failed to save issues\") catch {};\n                return CommandError.StorageError;\n            };\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Create a dependency graph from the store.\n    pub fn createGraph(self: *CommandContext) DependencyGraph {\n        return DependencyGraph.init(&self.store, self.allocator);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Output a generic error message in the appropriate format.\npub fn outputErrorGeneric(output: *Output, json_mode: bool, message: []const u8) !void {\n    if (json_mode) {\n        try output.printJson(.{\n            .success = false,\n            .message = message,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.err(\"{s}\", .{message});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Output an error with a specific result type for JSON mode.\npub fn outputErrorTyped(\n    comptime T: type,\n    output: *Output,\n    json_mode: bool,\n    message: []const u8,\n) !void {\n    if (json_mode) {\n        const result = T{ .success = false, .message = message };\n        try output.printJson(result);\n    } else {\n        try output.err(\"{s}\", .{message});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Output a \"not found\" error for an issue.\npub fn outputNotFoundError(\n    comptime T: type,\n    output: *Output,\n    json_mode: bool,\n    id: []const u8,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator, \"issue not found: {s}\", .{id});\n    defer allocator.free(msg);\n    try outputErrorTyped(T, output, json_mode, msg);\n}\n\n/// Initialize just the output without loading workspace.\n/// Useful for commands that do their own workspace handling.\npub fn initOutput(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, global: args.GlobalOptions) Output {\n    return Output.init(allocator, .{\n        .json = global.json,\n        .toon = global.toon,\n        .quiet = global.quiet,\n        .silent = global.silent,\n        .no_color = global.no_color,\n    });\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"CommandContext returns null for uninitialized workspace\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = \"/nonexistent/path\" };\n\n    const ctx = try CommandContext.init(allocator, global);\n    try std.testing.expect(ctx == null);\n}\n","numLines":164,"startLine":1,"totalLines":164}}}

Show command for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz show <id>`\n//!\n//! Displays detailed information about a single issue.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Comment = models.Comment;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\nconst DependencyGraph = common.DependencyGraph;\n\npub const ShowError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    IssueNotFound,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const ShowResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issue: ?Issue = null,\n    depends_on: ?[]const []const u8 = null,\n    blocks: ?[]const []const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    show_args: args.ShowArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return ShowError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n    var issue = (try ctx.store.getWithRelations(show_args.id)) orelse {\n        try common.outputNotFoundError(ShowResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, show_args.id, allocator);\n        return ShowError.IssueNotFound;\n    };\n    defer issue.deinit(allocator);\n\n    var graph = ctx.createGraph();\n\n    const deps = try graph.getDependencies(show_args.id);\n    defer graph.freeDependencies(deps);\n\n    const dependents = try graph.getDependents(show_args.id);\n    defer graph.freeDependencies(dependents);\n\n    if (structured_output) {\n        var depends_on_ids: ?[][]const u8 = null;\n        var blocks_ids: ?[][]const u8 = null;\n\n        if (deps.len > 0) {\n            depends_on_ids = try allocator.alloc([]const u8, deps.len);\n            for (deps, 0..) |dep, i| {\n                depends_on_ids.?[i] = dep.depends_on_id;\n            }\n        }\n\n        if (dependents.len > 0) {\n            blocks_ids = try allocator.alloc([]const u8, dependents.len);\n            for (dependents, 0..) |dep, i| {\n                blocks_ids.?[i] = dep.issue_id;\n            }\n        }\n\n        defer {\n            if (depends_on_ids) |ids| allocator.free(ids);\n            if (blocks_ids) |ids| allocator.free(ids);\n        }\n\n        try ctx.output.printJson(ShowResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .issue = issue,\n            .depends_on = depends_on_ids,\n            .blocks = blocks_ids,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try ctx.output.printIssue(issue);\n\n        if (deps.len > 0) {\n            try ctx.output.print(\"\\nDepends on:\\n\", .{});\n            for (deps) |dep| {\n                try ctx.output.print(\"  - {s}\\n\", .{dep.depends_on_id});\n            }\n        }\n\n        if (dependents.len > 0) {\n            try ctx.output.print(\"\\nBlocks:\\n\", .{});\n            for (dependents) |dep| {\n                try ctx.output.print(\"  - {s}\\n\", .{dep.issue_id});\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Display comments if requested and present\n        if (show_args.with_comments and issue.comments.len > 0) {\n            try ctx.output.print(\"\\n--- Comments ({d}) ---\\n\", .{issue.comments.len});\n            for (issue.comments) |comment| {\n                try printComment(&ctx.output, comment, allocator);\n            }\n        }\n\n        // History display placeholder (requires event storage implementation)\n        if (show_args.with_history) {\n            try ctx.output.print(\"\\n--- History ---\\n\", .{});\n            try ctx.output.print(\"  (history not yet implemented)\\n\", .{});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\n/// Format and print a single comment.\nfn printComment(output: *common.Output, comment: Comment, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !void {\n    const timestamp_str = formatTimestamp(comment.created_at, allocator) catch \"unknown\";\n    defer if (!std.mem.eql(u8, timestamp_str, \"unknown\")) allocator.free(timestamp_str);\n\n    try output.print(\"\\n[{s}] {s}:\\n\", .{ timestamp_str, comment.author });\n    try output.print(\"{s}\\n\", .{comment.body});\n}\n\n/// Format a Unix timestamp as a human-readable string.\nfn formatTimestamp(unix_ts: i64,
